title: Rafael Nadal set to recapture world No 1 spot following Novak Djokovic's shock defeat
text:
Rafael Nadal has been absent from the Shanghai Masters but is guaranteed to recapture the world number one spot next month after Novak Djokovic went down to a shock quarter final defeat in China.

The 32-year-old Serb, who had looked to be back on his best form, was yesterday defeated 3-6 7-5 6-3 by 21 year-old Greek Stefanos Tsitsipas.

It means that Nadal, back in Europe with a sore wrist and due to be married, is mathematically assured of regaining the top position on November 4, regardless of what happens in the Paris Masters that takes place the previous week.

Rafael Nadal will recapture the world No 1 spot following Novak Djokovic's shock defeat

Djokovic was beaten 3-6, 7-5, 6-3 by Stefanos Tsitspias at Rolex Shanghai Masters in China

Djokovic's quarter-final exit was a shock after he'd appeared to recapture his best form

Roger Federer also went down to a younger player in Shanghai when he suffered an ill-tempered 6-3 6-7 6-3 loss to Alex Zverev. Federer was given a point penalty for twice smacking the ball into the crowd in frustration.

British number two Heather Watson confirmed her best week of a forgettable season when she made the semi-final of the WTA Tianjin Open, also in China, when she beat Poland's Magda Linette 7-5 6-7 7-6. The win ought to take her back inside the top 100 and secure her a place in the main draw of the Australian Open next year.

Dan Evans, who will officially become the British men's number one next week, is to link up with former coach Mark Hilton after he recently left the employment of Kyle Edmund the man Evans has usurped.

Edmund has been given a late wildcard into the qualifying event of next week's European Open in Antwerp, where he is the defending champion. He hopes to join Andy Murray and Cam Norrie in the main draw there.
description: Rafael Nadal has been absent from the Shanghai Masters but is guaranteed to recapture the world number one spot next month after Novak Djokovic suffered a shock defeat in China.
authors: Mike Dickson For The Daily Mail
